answers.answer: hiii ya :) dont think scan accurate at all!! they said my son was gonna be 4lb and disabled but he came out 7lb 5oz and perfect!!  would wait for next scan but dont go completely by it x

My first was 9 lbs 11 oz @ 40 wks....second was 9 lbs 1oz(@ 38wks) and had an ultrasound @ 34 wks n measured her as 7.5 lbs..so they were  right on for her larger weight..my third was 9 lbs 6 oz @ 39 wks..my ultrasounds have been good at predicting weight..

My first we only got two ultrasounds and they didn't do weight and all that but my second child they told me would probably be 8lb 5oz and she came out weighing the exact same as her sister 8lb 4oz. I'm currently 24 weeks pregnant with another girl and my scan at 19 weeks put her at 9oz  whereas with my second at 19 weeks she weighed 10oz so I think they're pretty reliable but it also depends on the technicians experience.
4-6 lbs is huge for the 24th week... it will be interesting to see what the next one says..
That's what I thought were not too worried yet because they said it'll be more accurate at 32 weeks and she's being tested for diabetes in 4 weeks
At 32 weeks my Dr told me my daughter was already measuring at 7lbs... I had her 3 weeks later and she was barley 5 lbs..
I had an ultrasound the day before my twins were born. They measured them at about 5.5 lbs each. My daughter ended up being 4lbs 11 oz and my son was 4lbs 5oz.
I just had an ultrasound at 23.5 weeks and my baby measured 1lb 3oz I think they are off quite a bit. At that rate she is going to have a 15lb baby!
